question: Which country houses "Mount Tomanivi"?
explanation: Mount Tomanivi is a 1324 meters high 150 million years old extinct volcano located in the Viti Levu Island of Fiji. This mountain which is previously known as Mount Victoria is the highest mountain of Fiji. This mountain and its associated forests are an "Important Bird Area" which houses critically endangered Red-throated Lorikeet, endangered Long-legged Warblers, and vulnerable shy Ground-dove and Pink-billed parrotfinch.
